main event: An object was observed in Kunia, Hawaii, on February 22, 1950, which appeared to be angular and the size of 2,000 watt lamps, hovered, moved to the north, maneuvered, and then disappeared.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 20 minutes,The sighting was classified as ground-visual and involved one object,The object was not viewed visually but was described based on its characteristics,It was suggested that the object could possibly be a balloon,The type of sighting was deemed doubtful.
sighted object: an angular object, size of 2,000 watt lamps
